noun.description: A person who proclaims or makes a public announcement; specifically an officer of the Court of Common Pleas.

origin: Mid 17th century. From classical Latin prōclāmātor person who cries out or proclaims (in an isolated attestation in Cicero, though the reading has been disputed; subsequently in post-classical Latin: 636 in Isidore) from prōclāmāt-, past participial stem of prōclāmāre + -or. Compare French proclamateur.
